text: .@BernieSanders has officially hired one of the most vocal critics of some of Sanders’ more centrist 2020 rivals. Sure this’ll tamp down worries about Dem-on-Dem bloodletting. https://talkingpointsmemo.com/dc/bernie-sanders-hires-fierce-biden-beto-harris-critic-as-top-adviser …
author: cam_joseph

text: Interesting. @BernieSanders hires former journo (and long-ago Bernie staffer) @davidsirota as his senior adviser. Sirota's written some absolutely brutal pieces on @JoeBiden — inc. this one:
author: cam_joseph

text: I’m starting to wonder if he’s just practicing his Ollies sans board at all these events. Or campaign parkour? #hesfreerunning
author: cam_joseph

text: .@BernieSanders campaign workers announce they've unionized with @UFCW400 — first presidential campaign in history to do so.

text: .@realDonaldTrump campaign texting supporters to fundraise off his emergency declaration veto:

text: And with him. And with NC Dems.
author: cam_joseph

text: In other news, the Bearsjust signed a new kicker after the “double doink" ended their playoff run last year. His last name? Blewitt.
author: cam_joseph

text: .@BetoORourke already has four endorsements from younger House Democrats, three of them avowed centrists and three female. Looking like a generational & House/Senate divide between the moderates developing between him and @JoeBiden.
author: cam_joseph

text: succinct. to the point.
author: cam_joseph

text: Shot of the year goes to...
author: cam_joseph

text: All Republicans have voted. A dozen crossed Trump: Alexander, Blunt, Collins, Lee, Moran, Murkowski, Paul, Portman, Romney, Rubio, Toomey, and Wicker.
author: cam_joseph

text: .@CoryGardner sticks with Trump on this vote too. Almost every Republican facing a tough 2020 general election has bet on siding with Trump on this — Gardner, Tillis, McSally, Perdue, Ernst. Only Collins split, of the 11 (!) R’s who’ve voted against Trump so far.
author: cam_joseph

text: 10 Republicans have already voted to buck Trump on the emergency declaration, with a half-dozen who haven’t cast their votes yet. This is a major rebuke.
author: cam_joseph

text: Op-ed oopsies!
author: cam_joseph

text: .@ThomTillis flip-flops. "I do not intend to vote for the resolution of disapproval."
author: cam_joseph

text: Why does it not surprise me that @PeteButtigieg was a @davematthewsbnd fan?
author: cam_joseph

text: Jailbreak! I was predicting 10-12 GOP defections on the #EmergencyDeclaration vote today, right now I’d take the over. Up to 8 already. Keep an eye on Gardner, Roberts, Isakson, Rubio, Toomey, Sasse, Cornyn…
author: cam_joseph

text: And in terms of power in the primaries (partly bc of the primary calendar), imho the most valuable voting blocs in order are progressives, African Americans, blue-collar populists, suburban moderates, Hispanics. Lotsa fungibility & overlap btwn the groups, however.
author: cam_joseph

text: Dem coalition remains Hispanics, African Americans, progressives, blue-collar populist voters, and suburban moderates. Generally the candidate who can dominate with 2-3 of those groups has won, but a broader coalition is necessary for any nominee. Tough in this crowded field.
author: cam_joseph

text: Agreed. Not sure which issue will play big but I bet one will. Bet Beto's TPP stance could become fodder...
author: cam_joseph

text: I would NOT want to be Thom Tillis or Cory Gardner today. Or Martha McSally, for that matter. Dunno why @realDonaldTrump keeps escalating on what’s clearly a show vote.
author: cam_joseph

text: Side note: It’s gonna be weird to have a Friends of Ireland lunch today w/o Paul Ryan, Boehner or Spicer.
author: cam_joseph

text: Hill source confirms @realDonaldTrump is headed up to the Capitol today — for the Friends of Ireland lunch on the House side.
author: cam_joseph

text: this’ll be awkward...
author: cam_joseph

text: .@timkaine on @BernieSanders' work on Yemen vote:  “He is very focused on not letting the president take congressional power on war making. It should be the one that we guard most jealously... I’ve been thanking him for doing it.”
author: cam_joseph

text: .@BernieSanders didn't wanna talk 2020 implications — "children are starving to death" — but made clear it's gonna be a big part of his campaign. "The issue of war and peace is obviously an enormously important issue for the people of this country," he told me.
author: cam_joseph

text:
Dems from across the spectrum praised him for his work.
Bernie critic @jamespmanley: "One of my raps against him in years past is he’s been stubbornly unwilling to engage in foreign policy debates, but that’s obviously changed."
author: cam_joseph

text: .@BernieSanders took a lotta shit in ’16 for lacking a foreign policy vision and legislative accomplishments. Last night's vote to end US support for the Saudis in Yemen undercuts both critiques — and sets up a clear contrast w/ Biden's Iraq vote.
author: cam_joseph

text: A rare show of public emotion from @senatemajldr. Choking up as he says goodbye to @StewSays on the Senate floor.
author: cam_joseph

text: .@senatemajldr giving farewell remarks for @StewSays on the Senate floor. He’s gonna be missed around Congress by a lotta reporters — myself included.
author: cam_joseph

text: Congratulations! I’m experiencing deep levels of jealousy.
author: cam_joseph

text: But it's so DIY!
author: cam_joseph

text: Aaaand, the Senate finally gavels the vote closed.
author: cam_joseph

text: The vote’s still technically open, but the Senate just voted to rebuke President Trump and end US support of Saudi Arabia in the Yemen civil war. Could force Trump’s first veto.
author: cam_joseph

text: This is largely symbolic, but it sets up the most high-profile schism between Trump and Senate Republicans to date. At least four GOP members are expected to vote with Dems on the resolution of disapproval, and many more may join them tomorrow.
author: cam_joseph

text: .@realDonaldTrump has rejected a last-ditch GOP effort for a compromise on his emergency declaration, boosting the likelihood the Senate will vote in bipartisan fashion to reject his border wall declaration on Thursday.
author: cam_joseph

text: Bethesda bagels are pretty good but overall I agree with you. Bullfrog sucks. DC is a seriously underrated food city (or at least metro area). NYC might not  even be a top 5 US food city though.
author: cam_joseph

text: you should try it. you’ll have egg on your face.
author: cam_joseph

text: Huge step in the right direction. After college, I couldn’t afford an unpaid internship. I was only able to break into journalism bc @QuinnMcCord & @amyewalter gave me a shot as a paid intern at @njhotline. And my fam is solidly middle class. DC needs to look more like the US.
author: cam_joseph

text: Yup! Might get two Claremont alumni in the race if she and Bullock both run.

text: I made a joke tweet about Marianne Williamson and someone added me to her press list. Serves me right.

text: Congrats Al! And great hire, @bobcusack! Couldn’t pick a nicer guy.
